solution_line_template: He bikes {work_distance_one_way}*{trips_per_day}=<<{work_distance_one_way}*{trips_per_day}={daily_work_miles}>>{daily_work_miles} miles each day for work
So he bikes {daily_work_miles}*{workdays}=<<{daily_work_miles}*{workdays}={total_work_miles}>>{total_work_miles} miles for work
That means he bikes a total of {total_work_miles}+{weekend_ride_miles}=<<{total_work_miles}+{weekend_ride_miles}={total_miles}>>{total_miles} miles for work
So he bikes a total of {total_miles}/{bike_speed}=<<{total_miles}/{bike_speed}={total_hours}>>{total_hours} hours
